ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class LightLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.LightLocalizer

  • public class LightLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    The class will help the robot to localize on the playing field using light sensors attached to the robot.
    Author:
    Kevin

      • localize

        public void localize()
        Method used to locate the precise location of the initial position and adjust the robot to 0 degrees afterwards.

      • localize_not_corner

        public static void localize_not_corner(int target_x,
                                       int target_y)
        Method used to localize the robot when there are no walls around. It will localize itself to a precise location using the x and y coordinates
        Parameters:
        target_x - The x-coordinate of the target
        target_y - The y-coordinate of the target

      • cal_angle_diff

        public static double cal_angle_diff(double angle1,
                                    double angle2)
        This method is responsible to find the smallest difference of two angles.
        Parameters:
        angle1 - This is the first angle
        angle2 - This is the second angle
        Returns:
        double The difference of the two angles

        public static int convertAngle(double angle)
        Converts input angle to the total rotation of each wheel needed to rotate the robot by that angle.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to rotate the robot by the angle

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double distance)
        Converts input distance to the total rotation of each wheel needed to cover that distance.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to cover the distance
